entries.title: Margin Variance Alerts
entries.summary: Jobs now display a visual warning when the forecasted margin drops more than 5% from the original estimate.
entries.whyItMatters: You can now spot troubled jobs earlier. Instead of discovering margin erosion at month-end, you'll see a warning as soon as the forecast changes significantly. This gives you time to investigate and course-correct before small problems become big losses.

entries.title: Automatic Cost-to-Complete Updates
entries.summary: When you update costs to date, the system now automatically recalculates cost-to-complete based on your original budget proportions.
entries.whyItMatters: This reduces manual data entry and helps keep your forecasts current. Previously, updating costs required manually adjusting cost-to-complete. Now the math happens automatically, so your WIP report stays accurate with less effort.

entries.title: Overbilling Percentage Corrected
entries.summary: Fixed an issue where jobs with overbilling were displaying incorrect percentages in the Company View summary.
entries.whyItMatters: Your Company View now shows accurate overbilling totals. This was a display issue only - your actual job data was correct. The summary now matches what you see on individual job cards.

entries.title: Percent Complete Now Calculated Per Cost Category
entries.summary: Percent complete is now calculated separately for Labor, Material, and Other costs, then combined for total earned revenue.
entries.whyItMatters: This matches standard construction accounting practices and produces more accurate earned revenue calculations. If your labor is 80% complete but materials are only 50% delivered, your earned revenue now reflects that difference rather than averaging them together.
entries.actionDescription: Review your active jobs to ensure cost-to-complete estimates are entered for each category (Labor, Material, Other) rather than just as a total.

entries.title: Change Order Management
entries.summary: You can now track change orders separately from the base contract, with support for both pending and approved status.
entries.whyItMatters: Change orders are a leading indicator of project health. By tracking them separately, you can see how much of your contract value is still pending approval - critical information for cash flow planning and risk assessment.

entries.title: Dark Mode Support
entries.summary: The application now supports dark mode, which can be toggled in Settings > Appearance.
entries.whyItMatters: Easier on the eyes during late-night month-end closes. Dark mode reduces eye strain and works better in low-light environments.

entries.title: Week-Over-Week Job Comparison
entries.summary: The Weekly Review now shows how each job's key metrics have changed since last week.
entries.whyItMatters: Trends matter more than point-in-time numbers. Now you can quickly see which jobs are improving, which are getting worse, and which need immediate attention - all at a glance during your weekly review.

entries.title: Improved Excel Export
entries.summary: Excel exports now include all cost categories and formatting that matches the on-screen display.
entries.whyItMatters: Easier to share WIP reports with your CPA, banker, or bonding agent. The exported file now looks professional and includes all the detail they need for financial reviews.

entries.title: T&M Billing Calculation Fix
entries.summary: Time & Material jobs now correctly calculate earned revenue when using the markup method.
entries.whyItMatters: If you have T&M jobs with cost-plus markup billing, your earned revenue figures are now accurate. This was causing some T&M jobs to show incorrect billing positions.

entries.title: Company View Dashboard
entries.summary: New Company View shows portfolio-level metrics including total backlog, net billing position, and aggregate margin trends.
entries.whyItMatters: See the big picture. Instead of reviewing jobs one-by-one, you can now see your entire portfolio's health at a glance. Identify patterns across jobs and prioritize where to focus your attention.
